issue.body:
You must add this so that the link in the src attribute of the image components don't break whenever a user refreshes the page in a site that is statically built (eg using Github Pages).

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [ ] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [ ] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [ ] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [ ] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [ ] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. Changesets that add features should be `minor` and those that fix bugs should be `patch`. Please prefix changeset messages with `feat:`, `fix:`, or `chore:`.

issue.title: Error: Handler should return a Response object
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Using graphql-yoga in a +server.ts file the following error is returned:
```
Error: Invalid response from route /graphql: handler should return a Response object
```

This was working fine prior to sveltekit 1.27.1, but is now broken.

Looking into it, the yoga server is returning an object called `PonyfillResponse`, which I can see why sveltekit would not see this as a real Response object, but it was working before now so I am reporting it here in case this was unintentional.

### Reproduction

https://github.com/jamesbirtles/sveltekit-response-object-bug

This is just the sveltekit template with a graphql endpoint added (https://github.com/jamesbirtles/sveltekit-response-object-bug/blob/main/src/routes/graphql/%2Bserver.ts)

If you run this and visit /graphql you should trigger the error.

### Logs

```Shell
VITE v4.5.0  ready in 426 ms

  ➜  Local:   http://localhost:5174/
  ➜  Network: use --host to expose
  ➜  press h to show help
Error: Invalid response from route /graphql: handler should return a Response object
    at Module.render_endpoint (/Users/james/Code/sveltekit-response-object-bug/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/server/endpoint.js:48:10)
    at async resolve (/Users/james/Code/sveltekit-response-object-bug/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/server/respond.js:404:17)
    at async Module.respond (/Users/james/Code/sveltekit-response-object-bug/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/server/respond.js:274:20)
    at async file:///Users/james/Code/sveltekit-response-object-bug/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/exports/vite/dev/index.js:510:22
```



### System Info

```Shell
System:
    OS: macOS 14.1
    CPU: (8) arm64 Apple M2
    Memory: 3.29 GB / 24.00 GB
    Shell: 5.9 - /bin/zsh
  Binaries:
    Node: 18.16.0 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v18.16.0/bin/node
    npm: 9.6.6 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v18.16.0/bin/npm
    pnpm: 8.6.11 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v18.16.0/bin/pnpm
  Browsers:
    Safari: 17.1
  npmPackages:
    @sveltejs/adapter-auto: ^2.0.0 => 2.1.0 
    @sveltejs/kit: 1.27.1 => 1.27.1 
    svelte: ^4.0.5 => 4.2.2 
    vite: ^4.4.2 => 4.5.0
```


### Severity

blocking an upgrade

### Additional Information

_No response_

comment.body: The only thing that changed between 1.27.0 and 1.27.1 is that we stopped polyfilling various global objects in Node versions above 18.11

issue.title: the page doesn't re-render when router params changes
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Assume we have a route `/todo/[id]/`.
When user visit `todo/1` the the page is rendered with the data. But now when user visit `/todo/2` from `/todo/1` then only `data: PageData` changes not whole script tag will run as it will if we visit from other route other than `/todo/[id]`. It is not the expected behavior by default.


### Reproduction

Repo: https://github.com/anuragkumar19/sveltekit-issue
Live URL: https://sveltekit-issue.vercel.app/todo/1

### Logs

_No response_

### System Info

```Shell
I use github codespaces

  System:
    OS: Linux 6.2 Ubuntu 20.04.6 LTS (Focal Fossa)
    CPU: (2) x64 AMD EPYC 7763 64-Core Processor
    Memory: 5.45 GB / 7.74 GB
    Container: Yes

    Yarn: 1.22.19 - /usr/bin/yarn
    npm: 10.1.0 - ~/nvm/current/bin/npm
    pnpm: 8.9.2 - ~/nvm/current/bin/pnpm
  npmPackages:
    @sveltejs/adapter-auto: ^2.0.0 => 2.1.0 
    @sveltejs/kit: ^1.20.4 => 1.27.1 
    svelte: ^4.0.5 => 4.2.2

```

issue.title: Error 500 when accessing static assets using Bun
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

When using [Bun](https://bun.sh/guides/ecosystem/sveltekit), all requests to static content will fail wit a 500 error.

Therefore I cannot use Bun at all and had to fallback to pnpm.

Thanks for reading :)

### Reproduction

1. Run:

```bash
bun create svelte@latest example-app
bun install
bun run dev
```

2. Open `http://localhost:5173/favicon.png`

### Logs

```Shell
TypeError: parse is not a function
    at /home/lekshe/js/example-app/node_modules/sirv/build.js:168:18
    at file:///home/lekshe/js/example-app/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/exports/vite/dev/index.js:390:7
    at call (file:///home/lekshe/js/example-app/node_modules/vite/dist/node/chunks/dep-bb8a8339.js:50689:7)
    at next (file:///home/lekshe/js/example-app/node_modules/vite/dist/node/chunks/dep-bb8a8339.js:50633:5)
    at Function.handle (file:///home/lekshe/js/example-app/node_modules/vite/dist/node/chunks/dep-bb8a8339.js:50636:3)
    at Server.app (file:///home/lekshe/js/example-app/node_modules/vite/dist/node/chunks/dep-bb8a8339.js:50501:37)
    at Server.emit (node:events:514:28)
    at parserOnIncoming (node:_http_server:1107:12)
    at HTTPParser.parserOnHeadersComplete (node:_http_common:119:17)
```


### System Info

```Shell
System:
    OS: Linux 5.15 Ubuntu 22.04.2 LTS 22.04.2 LTS (Jammy Jellyfish)
    CPU: (2) x64 Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-2760QM CPU @ 2.40GHz
    Memory: 1.11 GB / 3.83 GB
    Container: Yes
    Shell: 5.1.16 - /bin/bash
  Binaries:
    Node: 18.17.1 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v18.17.1/bin/node
    Yarn: 1.22.19 - /mnt/c/Program Files/nodejs/yarn
    npm: 9.6.7 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v18.17.1/bin/npm
    pnpm: 8.6.12 - ~/.local/share/pnpm/pnpm
  Browsers:
    Chrome: 116.0.5845.96
  npmPackages:
    @sveltejs/adapter-auto: ^2.0.0 => 2.1.0
    @sveltejs/kit: ^1.20.4 => 1.27.1
    svelte: ^4.0.5 => 4.2.2
    vite: ^4.4.2 => 4.5.0
```


### Severity

serious, but I can work around it

### Additional Information

_No response_

issue.title: adapter-cloudflare-workers produces broken build with kit.paths.base filled with some subpath
issue.body: ### Describe the bug I wan't to embed sveltekit project inside existing project (I have no access to server, that's why I stick up with CloudFlare Workers to inject my code into new routes inside existing site). For example site.com/blog. In svelte kit doc mentioned that there is no problem to server SvelteKit not from the root of the domain. For that we should use kit.paths.base param. ```javascript kit: { adapter: adapter(), paths: { relative: false, base: "/blog" } }, ``` This works like a charm when I use local env or `npm run preview`. Problems appears when I publish site to workers. wrangler.toml ```toml name = "blog" account_id = "df3d22d535d31ae83574535632890645" main = "./.cloudflare/worker.js" site.bucket = "./.cloudflare/public" build.command = "npm run build" compatibility_date = "2023-10-01" workers_dev = true routes = [ { pattern = "b4ukraine.org/blog/*", zone_name = "b4ukraine.org" } ] ``` The config is pretty straight forward, but on workers env it broken. It seems that there are problems with router: It seems that path not matched to registered routes inside the app. ### Reproduction setup any `base` url parameter in sveltekit config, and deploy using `@sveltejs/adapter-cloudflare-workers` ### Logs _No response_ ### System Info ```Shell System: OS: Windows 10 10.0.22621 CPU: (20) x64 13th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-1370P Memory: 37.59 GB / 63.67 GB Binaries: Node: 20.5.1 - ~\AppData\Local\fnm_multishells\15836_1698362075353\node.EXE npm: 9.8.0 - ~\AppData\Local\fnm_multishells\15836_1698362075353\npm.CMD pnpm: 8.6.12 - ~\AppData\Local\fnm_multishells\15836_1698362075353\pnpm.CMD Browsers: Edge: Chromium (118.0.2088.69) Internet Explorer: 11.0.22621.1 npmPackages: @sveltejs/adapter-cloudflare-workers: ^1.1.4 => 1.1.4 @sveltejs/kit: ^1.25.0 => 1.25.0 svelte: ^3.59.1 => 3.59.2 vite: ^4.4.9 => 4.4.9 ``` ### Severity blocking all usage of SvelteKit ### Additional Information _No response_

issue.title: feat: image preprocessor
issue.body:
Implements the preprocessor described in https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/241. Please read both the description of that issue and the README in this PR for more details. Together with with the dynamic solution in https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/pull/10323 this is most of what we need to handle images. This pair of PRs would replace https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/pull/9787. ### Package setup I named it `@sveltejs/enhanced-img`, which is updated from `@sveltejs/image` in the earlier PR since this one is focused on the static case and we'll have a dynamic one as well This makes `vite-imagetools` a dependency. `vite-imagetools` includes `sharp`, which is a bit heavy and platform-specific, so we wouldn't want to include it for the dynamic case. However, for the static case, this means users don't need to add two packages to their `package.json` as in the earlier PR, which required installing `vite-imagetools` as well. However, if we have a dynamic preprocessor as well it will have to live in a separate package. This means that users could end up having to install `@sveltejs/enhanced-img` and `@sveltejs/dynamic-img` and instantiate both of them. I.e. one possible idea would be to combine this PR with [the `getImage` PR](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/pull/10323), to have an option to transform ``` ``` to: ``` ``` This could be a little more natural for the user to write. ### Performance Inserting `picture` markup for each individual image could bloat the HTML-creation JS. E.g. [this REPL](https://svelte-5-preview.vercel.app/#H4sIAAAAAAAAA3WQwW6EMAxEfyXyhUsFdwpd9TtKDykYsETASszSCuXfG5fVrrqrzckzmbFeskNPEwYoP3aYrUMo4Z0ZXkB-WEU44ySYdFhW36pThdYTy1szm3TI8eLF2DP1pveLM1le4Ld1PGGu5smGOvg2oGSv_xobfvFDQ82nDXLDQ4HnQfPpKmvmqriiJcHUyurxwlkd_ObYXO_KFo0-sm6AnB2wUKuBJ3klu8urdcsrXQrXexryNESzUSfjobdoRqRhlEOO0dhJ0iLBIH8rquKGmz7bLR31hB2U4leMn_EXyYC6MacBAAA=) outputs 42 lines of code in Svelte 5 today while [this REPL](https://svelte-5-preview.vercel.app/#H4sIAAAAAAAAA5WSwW6DMBBEf8XyhUsFqo8UWvU7Sg8OLLASBsteQiPkf69NUKOAUBpO3jFvNTPyzGvswPL0a-a9VMBT_qk1f-F00WGwZ-gI_GyH0ZRByWxpUNN70TP_odKDISbPWL-y2gyKRXECP1LpDuKgfkibW1NaoOjtDpngpPdIUA8RVM2e0H0TAH8XFf3OlHje1B55ZGpP3JnKkr_K_KCxpNHA2l927ZVdV-fzUqRjof284KhkA0nQCn4ALDVugKDdAG8i_J3Pob7YnxybsKJ2FSbHWsCmpXVuHZMd-V0ElpYtWXLz_K8A4tkAW-A4gNgGEJsA4kEA_5TVUGGNUPGUzAju2_0CeAAdIAUDAAA=) outputs 67 lines of code. Compare this to a component-based approach where you have 19+89 lines of output for a [single image](https://svelte-5-preview.vercel.app/#H4sIAAAAAAAAA41RS2vcMBD-K4MSkE2NfN-sEnrMKb3Hgajesa1g2UKa7bYI_ffqEbKhlNKL0Izme40Cm_SKnh2eA9uUQXZgX61lHaNfNhf-B66Eqfb72Y25c_Sj05buh20gbezuCB6NmhEmtxvgoi-VqEB-92lMm_ljCH8qY1cUdpsflJdWj3R2yIft2F_5t2Nl9m6UIaEjqJXkwAg9DQz6NJOcmf2kJ40ndiB3xth9BCng_42yIkHISl0W6UAI4ZLMN7dbDxEk3Np8bdq7PzyGGz1BltinDAcpJXBPTm8zj5n5mHOH9BQhJOp0fuaOJUY44Oqxjr_vorgaKNygGhd4-v6GIwncEjH6JrGJGsO3oDw8T7szKtnWObN_iRWc2OpUduaR8hbzuzDKNo1uQd7D623QorjLl0u8vLbibddbwzvgbSzRZOAF2HP4AlWq-i4O--zwXbGELf-VLaaiUl_0iZZr7xJhQT0vdG0t_9hOou2vWwm9nuLffv4l_gZpAGd6zgIAAA==) and 22+89 lines of code for [two images](https://svelte-5-preview.vercel.app/#H4sIAAAAAAAAA41RS0_cMBD-KyOD5EREjuC4rBdx5NTeCRJudpIYxYlle7tFlv97_UAsLQi4WJ7xN99j7MkgZ7Rkc-_JIhSSDbnVmjTEPetU2N84O4y1XQ-mT52t7Y3UbtctnZNKr8bBnRIjwmBWBZS1uWJlkF6_gUk1Xr6i8I9Qekaml_FGWK5l7w4G6b_wq6_h2_bkZ9kWJ9b03Ce1AGJ2vCMOresItLt3kKsPIDGtWvdykLgnG2cOGJrX5eTp765nRgc-STVJpAHGmIkyP82qLQTgcK7Ttaqv_8vhz-QASWId0jhwzoFaZ-Qy0pCYt9E6-PgUwEfqeL7lDjmG3-BsscBf9pVddc6foegn-PHrCXvHcInEaKvIxkoMW4OwcD-sRoloW6bM9iGU4chWUMmZRZfWmN6ZErqqZA18B4_nXrLsLl2O4fhYs6dVLhVtgNYhR-Oe5sGWwgUUqeI7O2yTwxfFHDZ_WLIYi0J9lHs3nXrHABPKcXKn1vTJdiJte9qKb-UQPvr5h_AXdTe8YyIDAAA=). We should be able to optimize the template creation such that a single image would output something like [this](https://svelte-5-preview.vercel.app/#H4sIAAAAAAAAA42QwQ6CMAxAf2XpGQEPXgiY-B3iYUKBJhssrICG8O9ukIiJHuypfU1f085QkUILyXWGVmqEBC7GQAD8NL6wIypGV9tu6AtPUkMFDz2e81a4SLeGsH1hkbMcInxIbRQeVChHqsQxjqdAvKne6CmechB-iRshLWuMPM_hD-2Ed_OtXekPree7lnTtnR_C0LS1m5mo5CZzVtEg1Q2vqVR-NaPl1ZBG--3uJborqSIsIeF-wOW2vACc45u6TQEAAA==) and two images would output something like [this](https://svelte-5-preview.vercel.app/#H4sIAAAAAAAAA-2SwQ6CMAyGX2XpWQUPXgia-BzOw4QCTTZcWAEN8d3dwAiJHnwAb_u_rF_TpgMUpNFBchqgVgYhgaO1sAK-2xBch5rRZ3dtmyyQNKfuIGvJqaWM2wbH4OP0Q7gmc8h7CRHelLEa13qjOirENo77lXhTM9Fd3EsQoZsvIaNKjAKX8IO2x4v91I70izbwWUumDM6FcGPr0tf0lHO191ZRIZUVj0-lQ2tGxy9DGi2m_y9jnj6NpvvwJ2OuORWEOSTctPg4P548vaPgbQIAAA==). However, I'll note that it seems like even in this case there's still some optimization that can be done in the Svelte 5 compiler as I'd expect these to output an identical number of lines. For these optimizations to work, it may turn out that we need the preprocessor to call the Vite plugin's `load` function to insert the results rather than using an `import` - this would obviate the need for special import handling in the Svelte compiler and allow more advanced optimizations there since it would change the ordering of the import resolution from after the Svelte compiler runs to before it. Also note that I somewhat took a shortcut route and just inserted an `each` block, but it'll probably be better to unroll that either in the Svelte 5 compiler or here in the preprocessor. It should be noted that the preprocessor also has the advantage of not needing to ship `getWidths` to the client, which saves about another 25 lines of code. ### Passing transformed image imports to non-transformed `` Right now this only has `vite-imagetools` transform images with the `enhanced-img` query parameter to avoid taking over existing imports. We have the preprocessor add this automatically. You must add it manually when you want to dynamically choose an image, but that's probably infrequent enough that it's okay. The other way of dealing with this would be to transform all imported images by default and users can opt-out with `?url`. I think it's pretty rare that you'd want to import an image and not transform it and can't really think of when you'd want to do that, so that option does have an appeal, but it could be unexpected. If we went this route it would be more important to work on our error messages as noted below. It's an error if you pass a transformed `img` to a standard `img` tag. The error message right now isn't great and can be slightly hard to diagnose. It ends up generating HTML that looks like `` which then makes a request giving the error message: ``` Error: Not found: /[object%20Object] at resolve (packages/kit/src/runtime/server/respond.js:483:13) at resolve (packages/kit/src/runtime/server/respond.js:277:5) at Object.handle (sites/kit.svelte.dev/src/hooks.server.js:19:9) at Module.respond (packages/kit/src/runtime/server/respond.js:274:40) ``` I can think of a few ways we might be able to detect this: - have the Svelte runtime check when setting an img src attribute in DEV mode that it's being passed a string - opt all `img` tags with a mustache `src` into preprocessing in DEV mode and then add a check that it's being passed a string - check for `/[object%20Object]` as URL in our 404 handling and suggest you might have forgotten a `` and should `view-source:` to see where needs to be updated - run a check after SSR for `src="[object Object]"` in the generated page source and print a warning similar to the one above If there's someplace a user was using an imported image other than an image tag most of these checks wouldn't save us, but that seems less likely to happen. The only thing I can think is if they were trying to output some sort of meta data via `{@html}`. ### Configuring For now, the preprocessor doesn't take any options. This keeps the API smaller and make it easier to land this PR. We'll probably have to add some options in the future, but it's not necessary to get an initial usable version out. There are some options like `deviceSizes` that we may want to share with the dynamic implementation and have live in the Svelte config. I think the dynamic approach needs to advance a bit more before we can say what it should look like though We could have the user add another instance of `vite-imagetools` for anything custom they want to do. However, this could be very frustrating because you'd be forced to create an `Image` component to use with it, which would be not only cumbersome, but would reintroduce the problems we're trying to avoid here by having a preprocessor rather than a component (i.e. event handling and usage of `:global` for styling). It might also force you to setup `svelte-preprocess-import-assets` yourself. Exposing `defaultDirectives` in some manner would probably be quite appreciated
For reference, here are all the options in vite-imagetools - `include`/`exclude` - it might be better for us to have our own filter or we might want to apply these filters to the URLs we find in `img` tags to decide whether to process that tag - `defaultDirectives` - could be useful. we would want to ensure correct `as` directive is used (`as=picture` unless there's a single format). there aren't too many [directives](https://github.com/JonasKruckenberg/imagetools/blob/main/docs/directives.md) you'd want to set on every image (`background`, `flatten`, `grayscale`, `lossless` might be some of the most likely). but some are useful - e.g. `background` plus `flatten` would further reduce file size. you may also want to create your own presets - `extendTransforms` - a common use case is the low quality placeholder discussed in the next bullet. could also be useful in other advanced cases, but seems uncommon - `extendOutputFormats` - it seems the main use case for this is the low-quality placeholder. i'm not sure this would be possible for users to do with this package without us explicitly adding support for it - `resolveConfigs` - this is pretty niche and not too likely to be used - `removeMetadata` - leaving metadata on optimized could be useful, but I expect uncommon. I think this should be made a directive instead of an option in `vite-imagetools`
### Including in the default SvelteKit template For now, this is not included in the default template. However, after we've released the dynamic one and let this bake for a little while, I think it would be nice to add it. ### Todo - Fix TODOs regarding type imports - help would be much appreciated! - Check what happens if only one of width/height is supplied ### Soon - Better filtering of URLs (`../` should be allowed. better checking of vite aliases - Probably need to `load` the image for performance. This looks a bit tricky because I would also first need to `resolveId` to pass into `load`. After Paolo's PR in Svelte 5 is merged it will result in highly optimized output ### Later - Allow configuring - A bunch of possible `imagetools` improvements: - Investigate whether we can merge `imagetools-core` into `vite-imagetools` without breaking `astro-imagetools` - Caching (https://github.com/JonasKruckenberg/imagetools/issues/522). Sync with Arnaud about build caching in Vite #contributors channel - Figure out if we want to support low quality placeholders (https://github.com/JonasKruckenberg/imagetools/issues/86) - SVG support

comment.body:
Hey, you got a new more memorable username! I won't have to type `@s` and wait for autocomplete now :laughing: 

Great minds think alike!

![Screenshot from 2023-10-26 17-08-28](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/assets/322311/1c3accc1-2682-46aa-b1d6-f9105915d0ea)

We had considered it, but no one felt strongly enough to object to it. And perhaps more importantly, there weren't any other name options that we could agree on...
